"Topic Title: A History of Jewish-Muslim Relations: From the Origins of Islam to the Present
Course meets synchronously on Thursdays 1:00-2:15 p.m. with the remaining coursework as asynchronous materials. Course description: This course studies the relationships between Jews and Muslims from the origins of Islam in the seventh century through the twenty-first century. Major topics include Muhammad, the Quran, and the Jews; religious conversion; everyday life in the Islamic Middle Ages; Jewish and Islamic law; the impact of nationalism and colonialism on Jewish-Muslim relations in the modern Middle East and South Asia; and the use of history and golden age myths for contemporary political purposes.
